Legal_Issue: Whether the refusal to grant an exemption based on humanitarian and compassionate grounds violated procedural fairness or natural justice
Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, s. 25
Evidence_Assessment: Integration into Canada, risks in Guinea
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate unusual or disproportionate hardship
Legal_Rule: Minister may exempt individuals from visa requirements based on humanitarian and compassionate considerations
Procedural_Issue: Allegation of breach of procedural fairness or natural justice
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: No requirement for interview; all evidence considered
Key_Evidence_Considered: Applicant's integration in Canada, country conditions in Guinea
Applicant_Challenge: Denial of humanitarian and compassionate exemption
Legal_Rule_Source: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, s. 25
Defendant_Response: Officer considered all factors and found no unusual hardship
Remedy_Requested: Certification of serious question of general importance
Legal_Provision: Section 25, Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
